description: Code quality improvement involves enhancing the readability, maintainability, and performance of code. This is crucial for ensuring that software remains robust and adaptable to future changes.
you_have_this_if: You notice frequent bugs in your codebase.
Your team struggles with understanding legacy code.
Code reviews often highlight similar issues.
You receive feedback about code complexity from peers.
Your build process is slow due to poor code quality.

approaches.best_for: when you need to improve the quality of legacy code and provide automated suggestions.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach can automate fixes but may not address all contextual issues in the code.

decision_matrix.best_when: You have a legacy codebase that requires systematic improvements and automated suggestions.

start_here: Start with Quality Aware Code Fixing, as it provides a structured approach to enhance legacy code quality while offering automated suggestions.
